paper_abstract: Let denote the -dimensional hypercube with vertex set . A -polytope of is the convex hull of a subset of . This paper is concerned with the enumeration of equivalence classes of full-dimensional -polytopes under the symmetries of the hypercube. With the aid of a computer program, Aichholzer obtained the number of equivalence classes of full-dimensional -polytopes of and with any given number of vertices and those of up to 12 vertices. Let denote the number of equivalence classes of full-dimensional 0/1-polytopes of with vertices. We present a method to compute for . Let denote the number of equivalence classes of -polytopes of with vertices, and let denote the number of equivalence classes of -polytopes of with vertices that are not full-dimensional. So we have . It is known that can be computed by using the cycle index of the hyperoctahedral group. We show that for , can be determined by the number of equivalence classes of -polytopes with vertices that are contained in every hyperplane spanned by a subset of . We also find a way to compute when is close to . For the case of , we can compute for . Together with the computation of Aichholzer, we reach a complete solution to the enumeration of equivalence classes of full-dimensional 0/1-polytopes of Q(6).
paper_title: Equivalence Classes of Full-Dimensional -Polytopes with Many Vertices
